node.title: Father of soldier killed in Afghanistan hits out at Defence for 'intimidation' and 'threats' toward families
node.description: The father of an Australian soldier murdered in Afghanistan claims families were threatened and intimidated by the Defence Department against speaking about details of the 2012 attack.
node.content:
["The father of an Australian soldier murdered in Afghanistan has told a Senate inquiry\u00a0that families were threatened and intimidated by the Defence Department against speaking about details of a 2012 attack.", "Hugh Poate, whose son Robert Poate was shot dead by a rogue Afghan soldier\u00a0alongside ADF members Lance Corporal Stjepan 'Rick' Milosevic and Sapper James Martin, has given damning testimony to a Senate inquiry into the war.", "Mr Poate told the\u00a0hearing that Defence\u00a0abandoned the families of the soldiers and sought to cover up critical aspects about the deadly incident that occurred at a patrol base in Oruzgan.", "According to the Canberra father, at the end of a coronial inquest into Private\u00a0Poate's death he was approached by a senior officer about not speaking publicly.", "\"On the final day of the inquest, families were intimidated and threatened by the head of the chief of the defence force's personal staff that if we disclosed any of this contrived secrecy \u2013 that had been shown to be contrived \u2013 to the media we would face action by the Attorney's General,\" Mr Poate told the committee hearing.", "The alleged threat was referred to the Inspector General of the ADF, which concluded matters could have been dealt with better, but Mr Poate said the brigadier involved went on to win accolades for his service.\u00a0", "Last month, Defence confirmed the killer, a Taliban-sympathiser known as Hekmatullah, had been released from custody in Qatar, and his precise whereabouts remain unknown.", "", "
Sapper James Martin (left) and\u00a0Lance Corporal Stjepan Milosevic (middle) were also killed alongside Private Robert Poate (right).(Australian Defence Force)
", "
Afghanistan evolving into humanitarian crisis
", "Senators were warned the situation in the war-torn country could soon become the \"world's worst humanitarian crisis\".", "Save the Children Australia deputy CEO Mathew Tinkler called for at least $100 million in humanitarian funding and for the government to prioritise the survival of children in Afghanistan.", "\"Afghanistan is rapidly evolving into the world's worst humanitarian crisis,\" Mr Tinkler told the inquiry.", "\"Without immediate action from governments like Australia, the situation will become catastrophically worse.\"", "The inquiry has also heard the situation in Afghanistan is so dire after the Taliban's return, that families are being forced to sell their children to afford food."]
